page.title: 06AN ARABLE FARM NEAR BRECHIN
page.content: {Maisondieu}farm is on the northern outskirts of Brechin.{Mr Mather}showed us over the{273}acre farm. He grows barley on 185 acres of his gently sloping land and he has grazing for his 60 Cross breed beef cattle. One field (15 acres) of hay, 8 acres of turnips and 18 acres of potatoes (grown by a contractor) completes the farm. The old steading, soon to be entirely renewed, provides cattle courts and space for his range of machinery e.g. 3 tractors, combine harvester, sprayer, baler and trailer. Storage space for food concentrates and hay is also available.The farmer only employs one worker.Much barley is sold and enters the large{EEC}store at{Dubton {of Stracathro.}The catle are sold at {Montrose}auction mart.These crop and livestock sales provide the profits.
